name: %BQUOTE
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %EVAL
description: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using integer arithmetic.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: specifies an integer arithmetic expression or a logical expression to evaluate.

name: %INDEX
description: Returns the position of the first character of a string.

arguments.name: source-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string as the source string.

arguments.name: target-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string as the target string.

name: %KCMPRES
description: Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: text or text expression.

name: %KINDEX
description: Returns the position of the first character of a string.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: is a character string or text expression.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character string or text expression.

name: %KLEFT
description: Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

name: %KLENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string.

name: %KSCAN
description: Search for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a character string or a text expression. If argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, listed here, use %QKSCAN.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return. If n is greater than the number of words in argument, the functions return a null string. If n is negative, %KSCAN examines the character string and selects the word that starts at the end of the string and searches backward.

arguments.name: delimiter
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that produces characters that you want %QKSCAN to use as word separators in the character expression.

name: %KSUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a character string or a text expression. If argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, listed here, use %QKSUBSTR.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring. If position is greater than the number of characters in the string, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR issue a warning message and return a null value.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring. If length is greater than the number of characters following position in argument, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR issue a warning message and return a substring containing the characters from position to the end of the string. By default, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR produce a string containing the characters from position to the end of the character string.

name: %KUPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

name: %LENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string.

name: %NRBQUOTE
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string that might contain one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %NRQUOTE
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %NRSTR
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in constant text during macro compilation.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %QKCMPRES
description: Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: text or text expression.

name: %QKLEFT
description: Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

name: %QKSCAN
description: Search for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a character string or a text expression. If argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, listed here, use %QKSCAN.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return. If n is greater than the number of words in argument, the functions return a null string. If n is negative, %KSCAN examines the character string and selects the word that starts at the end of the string and searches backward.

arguments.name: delimiter
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that produces characters that you want %QKSCAN to use as word separators in the character expression.

name: %QKSUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a character string or a text expression. If argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, listed here, use %QKSUBSTR.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring. If position is greater than the number of characters in the string, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR issue a warning message and return a null value.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring. If length is greater than the number of characters following position in argument, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR issue a warning message and return a substring containing the characters from position to the end of the string. By default, %KSUBSTR and %QKSUBSTR produce a string containing the characters from position to the end of the character string.

name: %QKUPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

name: %QSCAN
description: Searches for a word and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return.

arguments.name: charlist
arguments.description: specifies an optional character expression that initializes a list of characters.

arguments.name: modifiers
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, a variable, or an expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the %QSCAN function.

name: %QSUBSTR
description: Produces a substring and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains special characters and mnemonic operators.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: specifies an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the first character in the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: specifies an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring.

name: %QSYSFUNC
description: Executes functions and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: specifies the name of the function to execute.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: specifies one or more arguments used by function.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies an optional format to apply to the result of function.

name: %QUOTE
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %QUPCASE
description: Converts a value to uppercase and returns a result that masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains one or more special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %SCAN
description: Searches for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or a text expression that results in a character string.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return.

arguments.name: delimiters
arguments.description: specifies an optional character expression that initializes a list of delimiters.

arguments.name: modifiers
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, a variable, or an expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the %SCAN function.

name: %STR
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in constant text at macro compilation.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that contains special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %SUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string as the source string.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: specifies an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the first character in the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: specifies an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring.

name: %SUPERQ
description: Masks all special characters and mnemonic operators at macro execution but prevents further resolution of the value.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro variable or an expression that results in the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

name: %SYMEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro variable or an expression that results in the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

name: %SYMGLOBL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is global in scope.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro variable or an expression that results in the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

name: %SYMLOCAL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is local in scope.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro variable or a text expression that results in the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

name: %SYSEVALF
description: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using floating-point arithmetic.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: specifies an arithmetic or logical expression to evaluate.

arguments.name: BOOLEAN
arguments.description:
returns
• 0 if the result of the expression is 0 or missing
• 1 if the result is any other value.

arguments.name: CEIL
arguments.description: returns a character value representing the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the result of the expression. If the result is within 10—12 of an integer, the function returns a character value representing that integer. An expression containing a missing value returns a missing value along with a message noting that fact:

arguments.name: FLOOR
arguments.description: returns a character value representing the largest integer that is less than or equal to the result of the expression. If the result is within 10—12 of an integer, the function returns that integer. An expression with a missing value produces a missing value:

arguments.name: INTEGER
arguments.description: returns a character value representing the integer portion of the result (truncates the decimal portion). If the result of the expression is within 10—12 of an integer, the function produces a character value representing that integer. If the result of the expression is positive, INTEGER returns the same result as FLOOR. If the result of the expression is negative, INTEGER returns the same result as CEIL. An expression with a missing value produces a missing value:

name: %SYSFUNC
description: Execute SAS functions or user-written functions.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: is the name of the function to execute. This function can be a SAS function, a function written with SAS/TOOLKIT software, or a function created using the . The function cannot be a macro function.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: specifies one or more arguments used by function.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies an optional format to apply to the result of function.

name: %SYSGET
description: Returns the character string that is the value of the environment variable passed as the argument.

arguments.name: environment-variable
arguments.description: specifies the name of an environment variable.

name: %SYSMACEXEC
description: Returns an indication of the execution status of a macro.

arguments.name: macro-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro or an expression that results in the name of a macro without the leading percent sign.

name: %SYSMACEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro definition in the Work.SASMacr or Work.SASMacn catalog.

arguments.name: macro-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a macro or an expression that results in the name of a macro without the leading percent sign.

name: %SYSMEXECDEPTH
description: Returns the nesting depth of macro execution from the point of the call to %SYSMEXECDEPTH.

name: %SYSMEXECNAME
description: Returns the name of the macro executing at a requested nesting level.

arguments.description: specifies open code
specifies a nesting level

name: %SYSPROD
description: Reports whether a SAS software product is licensed at the site.

arguments.name: product-code
arguments.description: specifies a SAS software product code.

name: %UNQUOTE
description: During macro execution, unmasks all special characters and mnemonic operators for a value.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string.

name: %UPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

arguments.name: character-string
arguments.description: specifies a character string or an expression that results in a character string that is to be converted to upper case.

name: %VALIDCHS
description: Validates the character(s) encoding compatibility for data set variables.

arguments.name: dsnm=
arguments.description: name of the data set to be verified.

arguments.name: libnm=
arguments.description: name of the SAS library to be verified.

arguments.name: ENCODING=
arguments.description: optional encoding name that the %VALIDCHS macro function uses to validate that the characters in the data set are valid for the specified encoding. If the ENCODING= option is not specified, the encoding of the data set is used.

arguments.name: COMPATIBLE=
arguments.description: optional encoding that the %VALIDCHS macro function uses to verify the compatibility of the data in the data set with the specified encoding. It helps determine whether you can successfully transfer the data set between a server and a client where the encoding is different. Incompatible characters can cause data transfer issues.
